clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Atezolizumab (Tecentriq) in Combination With Bevacizumab to Investigate Safety and Efficacy in Patients With Unresectable Hepatocellular Carcinoma Not Previously Treated With Systemic Therapy-Amethista
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIIB, Single Arm, Multicenter Study of Atezolizumab (Tecentriq) in Combination With Bevacizumab to Investigate Safety and Efficacy in Patients With Unresectable Hepatocellular Carcinoma Not Previously Treated With Systemic Therapy-Amethista

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase IIIb, one arm, multicenter, open-label study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of atezolizumab + bevacizumab in patients with unresectable HCC who have received no prior systemic treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3-5 NCI CTCAE v.5 Bleeding/Haemorrhage

secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) is defined as the time from initiation of study treatment to death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events with severity determined according to NCI CTCAE v5.0.

Progression-free survival (PFS) is defined as the time from initiation of study treatment to the first occurrence of disease progression or death from any cause (whichever occurs first), as determined by the investigator according to RECIST v1.1
Objective response rate (ORR) is defined as a complete or partial response, as determined by the investigator according to RECIST v1.1
Time to progression (TTP) is defined as the time from initiation of study treatment to the first occurrence of disease progression, as determined by the investigator according to RECIST v1.1

Duration of response (DOR) is defined as the time from the first occurrence of a documented objective response to disease progression or death from any cause (whichever occurs first), as determined by the investigator according to RECIST v1.1
Post-progression survival (PPS) is defined as the time from the first occurrence of disease progression as determined by the investigator according to RECIST v1.1 to death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Starting Second or Further Lines of Treatment
Number of Participants Reporting Symptoms in Patient-Reported Outcomes of the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (PRO-CTCAE) Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Participant self-reported symptomatic Adverse Events (AEs) using National Cancer Institute's Patient-Reported Outcomes Version of the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (PRO-CTCAE) questionnaire.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive atezolizumab 1200 mg intravenous (IV) infusions Q3W (dosed in 3-week cycles) + bevacizumab 15 mg/kg IV Q3W (dosed in 3-week cycles)
